meanings.definition: Of or relating to the nucleus.
meanings.sent1: The nucleal structure of the cell determines its function.
meanings.sent2: The scientist studied the nucleal changes in the cell.
meanings.sent3: The tiny nucleal details of the cell made the biologist smile.
meanings.sent4: Her passion for science was as strong and nucleal as the cell's core.
meanings.sent5: The nucleal importance of the nucleus cannot be overstated.

meanings.definition: Located in or near the nucleus.
meanings.sent1: The nucleal material was carefully examined under the microscope.
meanings.sent2: The nucleal components play a crucial role in cell division.
meanings.sent3: The nucleal proximity to the nucleus surprised the researchers.
meanings.sent4: Her dedication to her work was as close and nucleal as the nucleus itself.
meanings.sent5: The nucleal position of the organelle was clearly visible.

meanings.definition: Pertaining to the central part of something.
meanings.sent1: The nucleal idea of the project was to promote sustainability.
meanings.sent2: The nucleal concept of the theory was groundbreaking.
meanings.sent3: The nucleal focus on teamwork led to great success.
meanings.sent4: Her leadership was as strong and nucleal as the core of the team.
meanings.sent5: The nucleal essence of the plan was to create a positive impact.
